snippet.title: Harvard admitted a majority nonwhite class for the first time in history
snippet.content:
For the first time in its nearly 400-year history, Harvard has admitted a majority nonwhite class,
Official figures released by the college show that the entering class of 2021 is:
• 22.2% Asian American • 14.6% African American • 11.6% Hispanic or Latino • 2.5% Native American or Pacific Islander
Of the entering freshman class, 50.8% are from minority groups, an increase from the 47.3% figure last year, The Globe reported.
The news comes just as the Department of Justice indicated it planned to related to its admissions process.
called Students for Fair Admissions in 2015, alleging that the college and other Ivy League institutions use racial quotas to admit students to the detriment of more qualified Asian-American applicants. The group includes a coalition of more than 60 Asian-American groups.
